citation.article-title: Geothrix fermentans gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel Fe(III)-reducing bacterium from a hydrocarbon-contaminated aquifer

p.s: Geothrix (Ge'o.thrix. Gr. n. gea Earth; Gr. fem. n. thrix hair; M.L. fem. n. Geothrix hair-like cell from the earth)
Rod-shaped cells, 1-2 x 0-1 Î¼m, non-motile, nonspore- forming.
Cells occur singly or in chains.
Strictly anaerobic chemo-organotroph that oxidizes acetate with Fe(III) serving as the sole electron acceptor.
Cells grown with Fe(III) or fumarate as an electron acceptor contain a c-type cytochrome(s).
